thread.title: 'Je suis Sweden': Donald Trump faces wave of mockery after appearing to invent terror attack
thread.title_full: 'Je suis Sweden': Donald Trump faces wave of mockery after appearing to invent terror attack

author: Saphora Smith
title: 'Je suis Sweden': Donald Trump faces wave of mockery after appearing to invent terror attack
text:
11:14   Donald Trump has faced a wave of mockery on Twitter Getty Images 
Donald Trump has faced a wave of mockery on social media after he seemingly invented a terrorist attack in Sweden . 
The US President was bombarded with messages ridiculing his comments over the weekend, as the hashtags #JeSuisIKEA and #WeWillRebuild began trending on Twitter. 
Speaking to thousands of supporters in Florida on Saturday Mr Trump linked migration flows to terrorist attacks mentioning incidents in Brussels, Nice, and Paris – before suggesting there had been an attack in Sweden on Friday. 
"We’ve got to keep our country safe," he told the crowd in Melbourne. "You look at what’s happening in Germany, you look at what’s happening last night in Sweden. 
“Sweden, who would believe this? Sweden. They took in large numbers. They’re having problems like they never thought possible.” "Sweden.. Don't doubt me. I know all about #Sweden . I am an expert on Sweden..." #TrumpRally #lastnightinSweden #JeSuisIKEA pic.twitter.com/RSgGK9DnlF — Michael Smyth (@MichaelSmyth_) February 19, 2017 
People around the world turned to Swedish media outlets and the official @Sweden twitter account to check if they had missed an attack in the Scandinavian nation. 
On discovering that no terrorist attack had occurred social media users took to Twitter and Facebook to condemn and mock Mr Trump under the hashtag #JeSuisIKEA. — Julian Power (@JueRobWilPo) February 19, 2017 
The hashtag pokes fun at Mr Trump’s gaffe by offering solidarity to Sweden’s most famous export - the flat-pack furniture company Ikea. 
A picture of an Allen key and the Swedish flag inscribed with the message “we will rebuild” was also circulated widely across the platform. A tremendous accident happened last night in Sweden #JeSuisIkea pic.twitter.com/YoWGICmNet — Gaia Greco (@gaiagreco_00) February 19, 2017 
One user, tweeting as Claudia, posted the picture writing: “Always forget what never happened in Sweden. #JeSuisIkea #swedenincident” — Heather Laurel (@RunningSoprano) February 20, 2017 
Many posted pictures of themselves struggling to build Ikea furniture with captions about the “tragic” and “terrible” accident which happened on Friday night. Trump blames bizarre Sweden comment on Fox News report 
One user, Gaia Greco, posted a picture of herself building an Ikea chair back to front with the caption: “A tremendous accident happened last night in Sweden #JeSuisIkea” 
Julian Power posted a picture of himself looking confused while building what appears to be a flat-pack wardrobe, with the caption: “Scenes of appalling despair #LastNightInSweden”
